newsitem.title: BULGARIA: Bulgarian cabinet resigns, premier quits.
newsitem.headline: Bulgarian cabinet resigns, premier quits.

text.p: Bulgarian Prime Minister Zhan Videnov on Saturday presented the resignation of his cabinet at a congress of his Bulgarian Socialist Party and said he would not seek re-election as premier or party leader.

"As of this morning, parliament will have the resignation of the government. This will enable the Democratic Left to present for support in parliament the government Bulgaria needs today," he told the opening session of the congress
Videnov said he felt he lacked the necessary support from the party and from society as a whole to continue as premier, and the congress would appoint a new cabinet headed by someone else.
"I declare my firm intention not to run for a leading post in the party or the government," said Videnov, who became prime minister when the Socialists won parliamentary elections in December 1994.

He said he believed his resignation would help satisfy opposition demands that tough economic reforms be introduced by political consensus, while sparing the country the need for parliamentary elections.
